dataset_description: CAC40, previously known as Bourse de Paris, is a benchmark French stock market index. The index represents a capitalization-weighted measure of the 40 most significant stocks among the 100 largest market caps on the Euronext Paris. Its acronym stands for Cotation Assist√©e en Continu, which translates to continuous assisted trading, and is used as a benchmark index for funds investing in the French stock market.
